title: Sub-Saharan Africa SME
content:
Job ID: 942
We're looking for someone to join the Media Manipulation Monitor (M3) team as we decipher information operations (IO) for discerning US government and Fortune 50 clients. M3 decodes the Chinese and Russian government’s manipulation of the global information space, and we need a language- and data-enabled Subject Matter Expert to help our clients make sense of adversarial IO in Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA).
What you’ll do
As a Subject Matter Expert at M3, you will be responsible for curating and analyzing signal-rich data to extract actionable insights about Chinese and Russian IO in SSA. You’ll bring expertise in local language (preferably French), the social media landscape, and data analytics to help solve some of the most important foreign policy questions facing the US Government today. You'll work with M3’s team of Subject Matter Experts to deliver valuable analysis in written and spoken formats to our list of elite clients.
In this position, you’ll work with our team of SMEs to:

Use our internal data platform and proprietary data science tools to identify IO trends and anomalous events, then interpret these findings for clients.
Identify and analyze how narratives and propaganda campaigns spread on social media platforms in target regions and languages.
Write reports, ranging from time sensitive alerts to in-depth analysis on current events.
Communicate your analysis to our customer base and act as a customer success advocate to continuously improve the quality of our product.
Research and explore new data sources in English and relevant regional languages, such as French.
Work with our data scientists and engineers to develop novel technology that improves M3’s capacity to turn data into actionable insights.
Embody analytic excellence and consistently challenge our team’s assumptions.

More about the role
At Two Six, we strive to solve problems collaboratively, innovate and respond to feedback. We always seek to include, thank, celebrate, and be kind to our team members. As a Sub-Saharan Africa SME, you will embody these values, working independently and with your team to find creative solutions and tackle challenging problems with cutting-edge technology.

You'll work with members of our Data Science, Engineering, and Product teams to iterate on and improve our collection, data analytics, and content production processes. 
That said, we do not expect our SMEs to code. We train all SMEs in quantitative methods and AI/ML tools, and create space for them to work with complex technical systems. 
This position is fully remote, just like the rest of the M3 team. Our normal business hours tend to align with the East Coast, but we are flexible and we work with teammates and clients around the world.

What we’re looking for in a Sub-Saharan Africa SME
Here are some of the skills and requirements you’ll need to dive into the role:

Strong writing skills, especially with crafting concise, data-oriented reports.
Professional fluency in French. 
Experience living, working, and/or studying in Sub-Saharan African nations.
Strong understanding of Sub-Saharan Africa’s traditional and social media environment.
Knowledge of Sub-Saharan Africa countries’ relations with foreign powers, especially China and the US.
Demonstrated initiative and problem solving skills.
Great organization, attention to detail, ability to work within and meet deadlines.
Proficiency in office technology, including Google Drive, Google Docs, Microsoft Office, and video call software.
This role’s work is unclassified and no clearance is required, though all applicants must meet the requirements to hold a US security clearance.

Other nice-to-haves include: 
Members of our SME team have different expertise and come from a wide range of backgrounds. We’d love to hear what makes you uniquely able to serve our customers. Some of the qualities that might help you stand out include:

Proficiency in Swahili/Kiswahili.
A passion for communicating findings visually with charts, graphics, and design.
Love of solving problems with data. This can include—but is not limited to—turning to Python or R to scrape, clean, and analyze data.
A “futurist” in analysis, with exposure to elasticsearch/ELK Stack, machine learning, or natural language processing.
Broad exposure to the US government and a passion for mission.
Collaboration with teams of diverse, cross-functional specialities and a love for integrating the best that each brings to the table.

Clearance Requirements:

Eligibility for Security clearance

Location

100% Remote
